org.spongepowered.api.data.value

Interface BoundedValue<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - The type of value that can be compared
    All Superinterfaces:
    BaseValue<E>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImmutableBoundedValue<E>, MutableBoundedValue<E>

    public interface BoundedValue<E>
extends BaseValue<E>
    Represents a value that may itself be Comparable or can be compared using the Comparator such that the value is "bounded" by a getMinValue() and a getMaxValue(). For a majority of values, a BoundedValue is limited to being within it's destined bounds. Any BoundedValue that is out of it's intended bounds will throw an IllegalStateException if used or offered to a ValueContainer or DataHolder.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Comparator<E> getComparator()
      The comparator used to compare a value of the proper type.
      E getMaxValue()
      Gets the required "maximum" value such that the value is only valid if the following is true:
      E getMinValue()
      Gets the required "minimum" value such that the value is only valid if the following is true:

      • Methods inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.data.value.BaseValue

        exists, get, getDefault, getDirect, getKey

    • Method Detail

      • getMinValue

        E getMinValue()
        Gets the required "minimum" value such that the value is only valid if the following is true: 
         if (getComparator().compare(getValue(), getMinValue()) >= 0)
        .
        Returns:
        The supposed minimum value

      • getMaxValue

        E getMaxValue()
        Gets the required "maximum" value such that the value is only valid if the following is true: 
         if (getComparator().compare(getValue(), getMaxValue()) <= 0)
        .
        Returns:
        The supposed maximum value

      • getComparator

        Comparator<E> getComparator()
        The comparator used to compare a value of the proper type. Can be used for validation with the getMinValue() and getMaxValue().
        Returns:
        The comparator used for this value
